text.__SUMMARY__: Drosera roraimae is a sundew native to Brazil, Guyana, and Venezuela. It was originally described as a variety of Drosera montana before being raised to species rank in 1957.The specific epithet roraimae refers to Mount Roraima, a tepui or table-top mountain, where the type specimen was collected.
